originalTitle: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
title: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
content: This is the highest number of confirmed casualties from a single African country in the Ukraine-Russia war.

title: Former US diplomat sentenced to life for abusing two girls in Burkina Faso
content: He used the girls' mother's life-threatening illness as an opportunity to demand sex, said the US Office of Public Affairs.

originalTitle: Epstein tried to buy a palace in Morocco days before his arrest in 2019
title: A Mystery About a Super Big House in Morocco!
content:
Hello, Friends! Welcome to Our African News Corner!

Hello, amazing friends! It’s your kid-friendly reporter here, bringing you a fascinating story from our wonderful continent, Africa! Today, we’re going on a little adventure to a beautiful country called Morocco. Have you ever heard of Morocco? It’s a very special place, full of sunshine and friendly faces! Guess what? We have a story about a super, super big house! Not just any house, but a palace! Can you imagine a house so big it looks like something out of a fairy tale?

Imagine a Palace! What's That?

A palace is like a giant, wonderful house! It’s much, much bigger than your house, or even your school! Palaces often have many rooms, sometimes hundreds! They have big, beautiful gardens too, with colourful flowers and tall trees. Long, long ago, kings and queens used to live in palaces. They were built to be grand and special. Imagine running around a garden bigger than many football fields! That's what a palace might be like. Palaces are often made of special stones and have fancy decorations. They might have big gates and tall walls, like a castle. It’s like a place where dreams come true, isn't it?

Where is Morocco? Let's Find It on Our Map!

Morocco is a country in North Africa. It's just across the sea from Europe. So, it's part of our big, beautiful continent! It has warm weather and lots of sunshine. Morocco has big mountains and even parts of the Sahara Desert! Can you imagine camels walking through sandy dunes? That’s Morocco for you! It also has a long coastline with pretty beaches where the sea sparkles. The people there are very welcoming, and their culture is full of vibrant colours, delicious food, and lively music. Did you know that Morocco is famous for its bright, colourful markets? People call them 'souks'. You can find amazing things like spices, soft carpets, and shiny teapots there. It's a feast for your eyes and nose!

A Special House Called Bin Ennakhi

Now, back to our story about the super big house! In Morocco, there is a very, very special palace. It has a long name: Bin Ennakhi. Sounds like a magical name, doesn't it? This palace is not just big; it's very luxurious. That means it's extra fancy and beautiful, with everything a person could ever wish for. Think of shimmering tiles, comfy cushions, and big, grand rooms. It’s a truly magnificent place, almost like a museum because of how old and beautiful it is. Many people dream of seeing such a place, let alone owning it!

A Rich Man's Dream to Buy It

Once upon a time, not too long ago, a very rich man heard about this amazing palace, Bin Ennakhi. He lived very far away, but he thought, 'Oh, I must have that beautiful palace in Morocco!' So, this rich man started talking to the people who owned the palace. He told them he wanted to buy it. Buying a house, especially a palace, takes a lot of talking and planning and, of course, a lot of money! He was really excited about it. He imagined living in this grand place in sunny Morocco. He made big plans for the palace, thinking of all the wonderful things he could do there. Imagine wanting something so much that you spend days and days talking about it, making plans and dreaming! That's what this rich man was doing.

Why Didn't He Buy It? The Plan Didn't Finish

But guess what, my friends? Sometimes, even when you make big plans and really want something, things don't always work out the way you expect. The rich man did not end up buying the Bin Ennakhi palace. He talked and talked, and they were almost ready for him to buy it. But then, something big happened! We won't go into all the details, but his plans changed very suddenly. So, the palace stayed with its owners, and the rich man couldn't finish buying it. It was a very close call, almost like buying a special toy, but then not being able to take it home. Sometimes, in life, things just don't go as planned, and that's okay. The important thing is to always try our best and learn from everything.

Did You Know? More Fun Facts About Morocco!

Did you know that Morocco has a very famous city called Marrakech? It’s known as the 'Red City' because many buildings are made from red clay. It's a bustling city full of magic and history! Did you know that many people in Morocco speak Arabic and Berber? But they are also very good at speaking other languages to welcome visitors from all over the world! Did you know that Moroccan food is super yummy? They have a special dish called 'tagine,' which is a tasty stew cooked in a cone-shaped pot. And their mint tea is famous all over the world!

Always Be Kind, Always Be Curious!

So, the story of the palace in Morocco teaches us that big plans can sometimes change. But it also reminds us of the amazing places and stories we have right here in Africa. Even though the palace didn't get a new owner that day, it's still a beautiful part of Morocco's history. And Morocco continues to be a wonderful country to visit and learn about. It’s a big world out there, full of exciting places and interesting people. And our continent, Africa, is one of the most amazing places of all! So, keep asking questions, keep being curious, and keep exploring the wonderful stories from Africa and beyond. We’ll be back soon with more news from our amazing continent! Bye for now, friends!
summary: A rich man tried to buy a super big and beautiful palace named Bin Ennakhi in the sunny African country of Morocco, but his plans changed, and he never finished buying it.
whyMatters: This story helps us learn about a beautiful country in Africa called Morocco, what a palace is, and that sometimes even big plans don't always work out exactly as we expect, which is okay.

title: Gordon needs to stay 'fully focused' after Arsenal talk - Howe
